Node.definition: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: to be wrong or bad in the eyes (of someone); hence = state in which certain actions or patterns of behavior are considered bad or evil by (other) humans or deities, ► which often provokes them to anger

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)

Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing water

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood

Node.gloss: to send away|to divorce|to expel|to remove|to cast out
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities force (other) humans to go away from a certain location and/or position; ◄ due to a lack of affection, as punishment, or for other reasons
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

m.definition: = town; ◄ located in the Negeb (נֶגֶב) at the southern border of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► used esp. in combination with Dan (דָּן) at the northern border of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) to refer to all Israel

Node.definition: literally: to finish; hence: = process by which humans and objects completely disappear from existence
= container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing water

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
= distance that is equivalent to the distance an average archer can shoot an arrow
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process by which humans or animals stop living

= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail

plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= state in which an animate or inanimate object is relatively large in size
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄ usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing water

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= process by which young humans or animals undergo the natural development of increasing in size and changing physically on their way to being fully grown
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= person skilled at firing a bow
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= desert; ◄ located south of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) west of Edom (אֱדֹום) and north of Sinai (סִינַי) desert
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= name or title of man; ► king of Gerar (גְּרָר)
= man; ► commander of army of Abimelech (אֲבִימֶלֶךְ) king of Philistines (פְּלִשְׁתִּי)
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= relatively large group of people, usually with centralized leadership; ► assembled for a common purpose, such as warfare or a journey
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement

Node.gloss: to act falsely|to act treacherously|to deceive
Node.definition: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions
= a person's descendants
= a person's descendants

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to sojourn|to live as alien|to dwell
Node.definition: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
= action by which humans or deities express their disapproval of something with words
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= name or title of man; ► king of Gerar (גְּרָר)
marker that introduces an object or event that is regarded as directly or indirectly responsible for the event in focus

= hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄ usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= name or title of man; ► king of Gerar (גְּרָר)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= name or title of man; ► king of Gerar (גְּרָר)
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= particle marking a constituent or part of a constituent as the only condition for the entire proposition to be true

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

= large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth
= name or title of man; ► king of Gerar (גְּרָר)

Node.gloss: to make a covenant|to make a treaty
Node.definition: literally: to cut (a covenant); hence: = action by which two or more parties make a solemn agreement, accompanied by stipulations, blessings, and curses
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

Node.gloss: to cause to stand|to set (up)|to put|to place
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause a person, animal or inanimate object to be in a certain location, usually in an upright position
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= female young of a sheep (שֶׂה) ► occasionally used for sacrifice

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events

= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= female young of a sheep (שֶׂה) ► occasionally used for sacrifice
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= female young of a sheep (שֶׂה) ► occasionally used for sacrifice
literally: (someone's) hand; hence: = state in which humans own a particular object
= particle linking two propositions X and Y, by which Y represents the purpose or result of X
= an animate or inanimate object that functions as evidence or proof that something has taken place or that some decision has been made

= causative action by which humans create a hole in the earth by breaking up and moving earth, usually with a digging tool; ► in order to hide something, to set a trap, or to find something that one is searching for

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄ usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

m.definition: = town; ◄ located in the Negeb (נֶגֶב) at the southern border of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► used esp. in combination with Dan (דָּן) at the northern border of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) to refer to all Israel

Node.definition: literally: to cut (a covenant); hence: = action by which two or more parties make a solemn agreement, accompanied by stipulations, blessings, and curses

m.definition: = town; ◄ located in the Negeb (נֶגֶב) at the southern border of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► used esp. in combination with Dan (דָּן) at the northern border of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) to refer to all Israel

Node.definition: = name or title of man; ► king of Gerar (גְּרָר)

= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= relatively large group of people, usually with centralized leadership; ► assembled for a common purpose, such as warfare or a journey
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

= small, fast growing tree, about 10 m. high, to be found abundantly in deserts, dunes, and salt marshes; leafless, has green branches, and a wide crown; this tree has small white flowers, and its fruit is a capsule with feathery seeds; ◄ |itamarix aphylla|i*; ► has durable wood; ≈ could have a link with cultic worship

m.definition: = town; ◄ located in the Negeb (נֶגֶב) at the southern border of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► used esp. in combination with Dan (דָּן) at the northern border of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) to refer to all Israel

Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a biblical title for the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to sojourn|to live as alien|to dwell
Node.definition: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
